page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Our block is in West Cumbria by the Solway Firth.There are three villages. Flimby,Siddick and Seaton.Flimby a rather large village is very near the sea and consists mostly of old houses, shops and farms with a large mixed wood. Siddick, a rather untidy village has most of its houses boarded up. With only 4 streets it's the smallest village. Seaton is mostly council houses with an estate and a shopping area at one end.There are a few live stock farms.With all this it's the biggest village. The rail way line is mostly used for communication.It is kept open by taking factory goods. The shore is in danger of pollution from Nuclear waste.Most of the of shore is stony .
